sn4.16:1.2: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was instructing, exhorting, inspiring, and gladdening the bhikkhus with a Dhamma talk concerning the five aggregates subject to clinging.
sn4.16:1.3: And those bhikkhus were listening to the Dhamma with eager ears, attending to it as a matter of vital concern, applying their whole minds to it.
sn4.16:2.1: Then it occurred to Māra the Evil One:
sn4.16:2.2: “This ascetic Gotama is instructing, exhorting, inspiring, and gladdening the bhikkhus …
sn4.16:2.3: who are applying their whole minds to it.
sn4.16:2.4: Let me approach the ascetic Gotama in order to confound them. ”
sn4.16:3.1: Now on that occasion a number of almsbowls had been put out in the open.
sn4.16:3.2: Then Māra the Evil One manifested himself in the form of an ox and approached those almsbowls.
sn4.16:3.3: Then one bhikkhu said to another:
sn4.16:3.4: “Bhikkhu, bhikkhu! That ox may break the almsbowls. ”
sn4.16:3.5: When this was said, the Blessed One said to that bhikkhu:
sn4.16:3.7: That is Māra the Evil One, who has come here in order to confound you. ”
sn4.16:3.8: Then the Blessed One, having understood, “This is Māra the Evil One, ” addressed Māra the Evil One in verses:
sn4.16:4.3: ‘I am not this, this isn’t mine, ’
sn4.16:4.4: Thus one is detached from it.
sn4.16:5.2: Who has gone beyond all ʹfettersʹ.
sn4.16:5.4: Māra and his army do not find him: ”
sn4.16:6.1: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
